cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, TX and 115 mi S of Galveston, TX
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then expected to slow and curl north and northeast along the upper Texas coast into Louisiana mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / Port O'Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA (includes Port Arthur area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper and middle Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana coast, including Sabine Pass and Port Arthur
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds 35–45 mph with higher gusts are possible beginning late Monday and lasting through Tuesday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in Sabine Lake and along the immediate coast near Port Arthur when onshore flow peaks.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 15 inches could cause flash and urban flooding in and around Port Arthur.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip currents are possible ahead of and during the passage of Beta.
